name: lammps-cnt
title: Carbon Nanotube: Deformation and Relaxation
description: LAMMPS simulation of a carbon nanotube under uniaxial strain, followed by strain release to observe relaxation toward equilibrium, with temperature monitored throughout the process.
content:
Carbon nanotube deformed by constant velocity loading showing molecular bonds (pink), velocity vectors (blue arrows), and temperature evolution

Overview

This application simulates the mechanical deformation and relaxation of carbon nanotubes using LAMMPS (Large-scale Atomic/Molecular Massively Parallel Simulator). The simulation applies constant velocity deformation to opposite ends of the nanotube, then releases the constraint to observe recovery dynamics.

Scientific Relevance

Understanding how carbon nanotubes (CNTs) relax after sudden strain release is key to unlocking their potential in dynamic mechanical systems. Their relaxation behavior is closely tied to temperature, making thermal monitoring essential for capturing the full dynamics of energy dissipation and recovery (Bai et al., Science, 2020). Under constant velocity loading, CNTs exhibit sequential buckling, localized deformation, and partial recovery depending on their structure and loading conditions, as shown in finite element simulations and experiments (Hutchens et al., J. Mech. Phys. Solids, 2011).

Creating the Animation

After simulation completion, open analysis/visualization.ipynb in JupyterHub on Camber and execute all cells to generate cnt_trajectory.gif showing molecular structure, forces, and temperature evolution.
